# Major Scale in F (Mode: Lydian, Shape: G)

## Brief Overview
The F Major scale, when played in the Lydian mode using Shape G, offers a bright and uplifting sound with a tonal center of F. It is characterized by its raised 4th degree, which sets it apart from the standard major scale.

## Notes and Intervals
The F Major scale in the Lydian mode with Shape G consists of the following notes and intervals:
- F (Root)
- G (Major 2nd)
- A (Major 3rd)
- B (Augmented 4th)
- C (Perfect 5th)
- D (Major 6th)
- E (Major 7th)
- F (Octave)

## Musical Genre and Flavor
This scale is commonly used in genres such as jazz, fusion, and progressive rock. Its bright and distinctive sound is often associated with dreamy or ethereal musical atmospheres. The augmented 4th (B in this case) creates a sense of tension and resolution, adding a unique flavor to compositions.
